DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim trial test effectiveness intervention train primary care physician determine lead decrease parental vaccine hesitancy .
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim trial test effectiveness intervention train primary care physician determine lead decrease parental vaccine hesitancy . The investigator train primary care team initial training follow telephone coach follow-up visit , assess outcome parental vaccine hesitancy ( primary ) physician self-efficacy ( secondary ) baseline 6 month .
DOC.criteria: Study population : Eligible pediatric family medicine practice three county Washington State ; King , Pierce Snohomish Counties . Mothers whose infant receive care participate clinic . Inclusion Clinics : Located King , Snohomish , Pierce Counties , WA ; Family practice clinic ; Pediatric practice clinic ; Order > 1000 dos vaccine 2009 State Washington Department Health . Exclusion Clinics : Not willing randomize . Inclusion Mothers : Babies bear participate hospital ; Mother recruit discharged postbirth ; Mothers declare pediatric care one participating clinic ; Singleton twin pregnancy . Exclusion Mothers : Babies bear < 36 week gestational age ; Known medical vaccine contraindication ; Parental age < 18 ; NICU ; Triplet ; Maternal complication .
